6) Employee involvement in the Prevention Program.  This is addressed on two levels.  First, refrigeration equipment operators participate in the planning and evaluation of the Prevention Programs (e.g., Hazard Review study team, writing and/or reviewing operating procedures, Incident Investigation team, etc.).  In addition, some of these elements are reviewed and trained on annually or every three years or if a change is made at minimum as required by the code and industry standards. This involvement encourages ownership of the Prevention Program and positively affects the operators' day-to-day activities. 

Second, all Sacramento Valley Walnut Growers, LLC, employees and at this facility receive ammonia awareness training.  Additionally, they have access to the complete CalARP, the IIPP and more for review, comment and input.  These activities improve the overall safety of the employees.

7) Compliance Audits: Verification of Sacramento Valley Walnut Growers, LLC, 's compliance with the CalARP program.  The audit process is an important tool to confirm whether each of the elements in the Prevention Program has been implemented and properly documented by Sacramento Valley Walnut Growers, LLC, personnel.  Sacramento Valley Walnut Growers, LLC,  has established a Management System procedure to address any shortcomings, which the audit may find.  A priority list is developed, and target dates are set for any changes or corrections.   (Addressed under Compliance Audit Element)   

8) Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
A. Calibrate and test all safeties annually
B. Install remote notification system for alarms and failures.
C. Label all starters, disconnects and controls in electrical room and at gauge panel- I.E. d. 
D. Condenser fan and pump pressure control switches and ECB.
E.

	a bomb threat that could cause an anhydrous ammonia release 

3) Written procedures and policies are in place that establish how the refrigeration system is operated and maintained.  The facility shall develop standard operating procedures for the safe and normal operation and shut-down of the ammonia refrigeration system. The manufacturers OEM manual may be used for reference.  The standard operating procedures are periodically reviewed to ensure they reflect the current operating practices.

Prevention is the primary reason regular and scheduled maintenance is performed on the ammonia refrigeration system.  The system shall follow industry RAGAGEP, manufacturer recommendations, and/or industry practice to help maintain the system.  The facility utilizes outside contractors to perform routine and emergency maintenance on the system.  (Addressed under Operating Procedures and Mechanical Integrity Elements)

The facility has completed a field verification that equipment is installed and maintained as designed by way of an independent 5-year mechanical integrity inspection.  

All safety recommendations developed by the team are reviewed and addressed by facility management.   A priority list is developed, and target dates are set for the recommendations to reduce or eliminate hazards.  

4) Written procedures and forms are in place detailing how and when the facility must investigate accidental/incidental releases.  The facility investigates releases and near misses that could have resulted in a release of anhydrous ammonia.  Recommendations are addressed and corrected by facility management.  Reports are kept for at least five years. (Addressed under Incident Investigation Element) 

5) Certification of refrigeration operators to safely operate the refrigeration system.  Sacramento Valley Waln

The EPA RMP regulation requires that an Executive Summary be provided as part of the registration submitted to the EPA. 

This process does not meet the requirements of Program 1.  It is subject to OSHA's PSM standard.  Thus, this RMP is written to meet the EPA Program 3 level of compliance. 
Sacramento Valley Walnut Growers Capital Group LLC.'s program was updated starting in August of 2022 in conjunction with the 5-year update and personnel changes.  

Key objectives of Sacramento Valley Walnut Growers, LLC, Prevention Program are briefly described below:

1) Maintain current and complete refrigeration system technical information.  The facility has retained the original manufacturer OEM manuals, equipment drawings, etc. for reference purposes and aid in maintenance activities. (Addressed under the Process Safety Information Element)

2) Provide thorough team evaluation of the ammonia refrigeration system.  The types of natural and human caused external events considered in the hazard review include: 
	earthquake, tornado, extreme severe weather, flood (see above for parameters used in the seismic analysis)
	inadequate physical security devices (locks, lighting, fences) may lead to outside threats which may lead to an anhydrous ammonia leak  the facility does have fencing around the facility, lighting around the facility, locked and secured doors / fences
	lack of security awareness training for employees to help identify internal threats  employees are trained on an annual basis on the importance of reporting security incidents both potential and real
	an airplane strike 
	lack of workplace violence policy and/or procedures could lead to a potential anhydrous ammonia release  employees are trained on company policy concerning workplace violence
	anhydrous ammonia theft from equipment that is outside and not monitored  facility has a fence around the facility, the engine room door is locked with a sign indicating authorized personnel only
	a suspicious
